course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Instrumental Analysis
course.description: Continuation of CHEM 2310.  Topics covered include electrochemistry, mass spectrometry and separation sciences.

reviews.author: supermin
reviews.title: Not a good Course
reviews.comment_content:
Midterms
•Introduction to Instrumental Method: Chapter 1&Appendix 1
•Electroanalytical Chemistry-An Introduction: Chapter 22
•Potentiometry: Chapter 23
•Coulometry: Chapter 24
•Voltammetry: Chapter 25
•Atomic and Molecular Mass Spectrometry: Chapters 11&20

Finals
•Introduction to Optical Spectrometric Methods: Chapters 6&7
•Introduction to Optical Atomic Spectrometry: Chapter 8
•Atomic Absorption and Emission Spectrometry: Chapters 9&10
•Atomic X-Ray Spectrometry: Chapter 12
•Ultraviolet/Visible Molecular Absorption Spectrometry: Chapters 13&14
•Molecular Luminescence Spectrometry: Chapter 15
•Infrared Spectrometry: Chapters 16&17
•Raman Spectrometry: Chapter 18
•Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy: Chapter 19
•Surface Characterization by Spectroscopy and Microscopy: Chapter 21
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very boring lecture. It was even assigned to 9am class MoWe, so it's really not worth the time.

I can see that he tries to explain concepts, but really, the textbook has better explanations.

Prof Wu really needs to improve his ways of getting people's attention, to be honest.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterms:
30 minutes to solve 50 questions, and it takes like 30 seconds minimum to even read & understand what the question asks, letting you only 6 seconds to think and answer! And there's even calculations!

I took 20 minutes solving 20 questions, and that was rushed. remaining 30 were simply random guess.

Open book, though.

Mean 21/50, SD 6.7

===

Finals:

Same format as Midterms. Also open-book.
Prof gave 5 more min (35min total for 50 questions)
Mean 29/50, SD 8.74
reviews.comment_workload:
you need to memorize a lot.

A LOT

have fun.

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.title: Scourge of Chem
reviews.comment_content:
Pre-Mid Term:

- Classification, Analytical Methods
- Electroanalytical Chemistry
- Potentiometry
- Coulometry
- Voltammetry
- Mass Spectrometry


Post-Mid Term:

- Optical Instruments
- Atomic Optical Spectroscopy
- X-Ray Spectroscopy
- UV-Vis Spectroscopy
- Molecular Luminescece
- IR Spectroscopy
- Raman Spectroscopy
- NMR Spectroscopy
reviews.comment_teaching:
As worse as Chan Wan who taught An Chem I.
Probably he didn't know what he was talking.
Power Points were junky. NO main points. DIDN'T match any Intended Learning Outcomes outlined.

He was great and had obtained his PhD at Harvard, but he might not be apt at teaching. Perhaps, having him focused on his research, instead of lecturing a 3300+ course, would be better.
reviews.comment_grading: What could you expect at UST?
reviews.comment_workload:
This course has no exercises or homework. Yet the workload is never lighter than those requiring you to accomplish a project.

It heavily drains and strains students who are not smart.

The workload is purely derived from the junky Power Points that NEITHER have main points NOR have matched any Intended Learning Outcomes outlined.

reviews.author: Selenium
reviews.comment_content:
包括所有化學分析儀器既GRAPH,原理,作用果D
MT有電化學同MASS SPEC
FINAL有ATOMIC ABSORPTION, X-RAY,UV-VIS,IR,RAMAN 同NMR
算係實用既
考試都係考lecture notes野
reviews.comment_teaching:
教得幾好既
NOTES所有位都講得好詳細同清楚,
INSTRUCTOR講D英文好好聽~like it
唯一係可能會悶少少
reviews.comment_grading:
MT 46/100 mean 51(50%)
FINAL 55/100 mean 59(50%)
BELOW 不足1SD
諗住點都有C+
點知...得個C... OMG!!
真係冇野好講
reviews.comment_workload:
要背既野好多, SETUP,GRAPH,原理...全部有機會問到, 仲要畫SETUP...
好彩公式唔會點問(我呢個SEM係,唔知之前之後點), N禁多條中只問1-2條,且佔分不太多
除左BEER'S LAW之外其他我都冇背到...

reviews.author: YareYaredaze
reviews.title: 來回地獄又折返人間
reviews.comment_content:
mid term 前除左intro同個mass spec 叫做有啲用之外，其他嗰啲electrochem 既野真係唔知有乜用，學極又學唔明，淨係知佢用nernst equation。

midterm 後d content 對我嚟講起碼都算係interesting既，x-ray呀、UV-Vis、IR、NMR 之類，都可以見到係真係度緊個molecule 或者係atom 本身，個concept 就真係似返chemistry，而唔係前半part electrochem 往死裡計concentration。
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor 份人本身就幾nice既，但教書真係極度催眠，仲要4:30堂，要花至少一個月去適應佢個tone，適應完呢就應該明到大概5-6成content
reviews.comment_grading:
50% midterm
50% final

Mean ; SD
midterm: 44.55/100 ; 21.94
final: 74/100 ; 18

grading 意外地好lol，一個SD都冇攞左A
FYI:
midterm: 66/100
final: 89/100
reviews.comment_workload:
workload 來源於苦悶，實際學既內容其實唔多。

midterm仲chur 過final，真係會有想跳既感覺。

好彩佢midterm出卷都同past paper (佢比+上petergao揾嗰份) 都幾似，final就直頭9成一樣，真係拯救左無數既小生命 :')

reviews.author: hw1817
reviews.title: Finally reach the end of bad grade an chem
reviews.comment_content:
• Introduction to Instrumental Method: Chapter 1&Appendix 1
• Electroanalytical Chemistry-An Introduction: Chapter 22
• Potentiometry: Chapter 23
• Coulometry: Chapter 24
• Voltammetry: Chapter 25
• Atomic and Molecular Mass Spectrometry: Chapters 11&20

midterm till here
-------------------------------------------------------------
• Introduction to Optical Spectrometric Methods: Chapters 6&7
• Introduction to Optical Atomic Spectrometry: Chapter 8
• Atomic Absorption and Emission Spectrometry: Chapters 9&10
• Atomic X-Ray Spectrometry: Chapter 12
• Ultraviolet/Visible Molecular Absorption Spectrometry: Chapters 13&14
• Molecular Luminescence Spectrometry: Chapter 15
• Infrared Spectrometry: Chapters 16&17
• Raman Spectrometry: Chapter 18
• Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy: Chapter 19
• Surface Characterization by Spectroscopy and Microscopy: Chapter 21 (not covered due to time limit)

Final


To survive the midterm and final, make sure that you study the following things:

For midterm:
• Confidence intervals
• Ion/gas selective electrodes (how it works and how to draw it out. Don't forget the buffer)
• Error in measurement due to resistance
• Hydrodynamic voltamogram (I vs E)
• Differential wave volamogram (detla I vs E)
• CV
• All equations used in MS
• How to find MW from ESI

Final:
• sketch a monochromator
• how hollow-cathode lamp works
• X-ray absorption and emission spectrum
• XRF vs XPS (Why only XPS can tell the chemical state)
• Beer's Law
• conditions of IR active and Raman active
• sketch the instrument used in measuring phosphorescence and why N2(l) is used
• Why NMR tube needs to spin.
• Why He(l) and N2(l) are used
• Why 13C less sensitive than 1H (γ+abundance)

Remember try to write as much as you can in the exam even if it seems to be irrelevant or the questions seems haven't asked you to explain. A lot of fine detail will be used as the point for deducting marks.
reviews.comment_teaching:
As previous reviews have mentioned, the ppt instead of helping you to learn concepts, confuses you more. There are many pictures and graphs without any captions, or with captions of several lines with very small words fill the same page. I am confident that if he takes his ppt to Lang 3022, he will get a D range or even F. The only good(?) thing is that he can explain something well(?). (Unfortunately, he seldom releases his recording and forces us to choose either attend his lecture or learn by ourselves)

To survive, you MUST JOT NOTES in his ppt, as the material he covered but not in the lecture notes WILL APPEAR IN THE EXAM (e.g. how to calculate the ratio of the peak height of MS, how to work out the molecular formula from peaks of ESI, etc).

If you still find it confusing, you can borrow the textbook to have a look. The textbook explanation is much better than Prof. Wu's. However, you will find that Prof. Wu does cut a lot of content from the very wordy textbook. You had better find an online version. I have also read another e-book from LibreTexts https://chem.libretexts.org/Bookshelves/Analytical_Chemistry/Instrumental_Analysis_(LibreTexts)
reviews.comment_grading:
Everyone knows that the grading is very bad. Rumors have it that even IRE students get a mean grade in the B range in this course.

Midterm:
mean: 44.55
sd: 21.94
high: 94
low: 5

Final:
mean: 74? (just remember that it is 7X)
sd: 18?
high: 100

As you can see from the mean, the content of midterm is more difficult than that of final (maybe because the past paper he gave for the midterm is quite different from his real midterm, but the past paper in the final is almost identical to his real final)

My score:
midterm: 91/100
final: 96/100
grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: Very heavy. It is quite different from ordinary chem courses, and your chemistry knowledge is not useful in this course. You will feel like you are learning Engine, with the content of the components of the instruments, the working mechanism of the instruments, and how you use these instruments. It is totally not interesting at all, but it is practical (to a certain extend).

reviews.author: yo~
reviews.title: Danger Ahead!!
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to Instrumental Method
Electroanalytical Chemistry-An Introduction
Potentiometry
Coulometry
Voltammetry
Atomic and Molecular Mass Spectrometry
-----------------Midterm Exam-----------------
Introduction to Optical Spectrometric Methods
Introduction to Optical Atomic Spectrometry
Atomic Absorption and Emission Spectrometry
Atomic X-Ray Spectrometry
Ultraviolet/Visible Molecular Absorption Spectrometry
Molecular Luminescence Spectrometry
Infrared Spectrometry
Raman Spectrometry
Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy
--------------Final Exam(Not accumulative)--------------
reviews.comment_teaching: Extremely Poor, the powerpoint slides is not useful at all, mainly consist of images instead of words. The textbook is your friend in this course, it can help you understand some useful contents. The lectures are boring and not quite useful at all.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% Midterm Exam
50% Final Exam

I knew that the grading for this course is ultimately poor according to other contributors. But it is still poorer than I have expected, below mean not more than 1 SD still score me a C-, I know it was bad but I was expecting a C instead, very disappointing. It is my required course so I cannot drop, but if it is not your required course, drop it, else you will regret. This course ruins your CGA, danger ahead!!

This year's stats for reference: (Mean, SD)
Midterm: (44.55, 21.94)
Final: (74,18) (According to my memory, as not posted on Canvas)
reviews.comment_workload: Very high, extremely large amount of content to remember before the exam. Each exam is a challenge for your brain memory of cramming all the required contents.

reviews.author: 綿綿頭上飛花
reviews.title: Crazy contents and stressful course
reviews.comment_content:
He CANCELLED midterm. thus 100% final.

•Introduction to Instrumental Method: Chapter 1&Appendix 1
•Electroanalytical Chemistry-An Introduction: Chapter 22
•Potentiometry: Chapter 23
•Coulometry: Chapter 24
•Voltammetry: Chapter 25
•Atomic and Molecular Mass Spectrometry: Chapters 11&20
•Introduction to Optical Spectrometric Methods: Chapters 6&7
•Introduction to Optical Atomic Spectrometry: Chapter 8
•Atomic Absorption and Emission Spectrometry: Chapters 9&10
•Atomic X-Ray Spectrometry: Chapter 12
•Ultraviolet/Visible Molecular Absorption Spectrometry: Chapters 13&14
•Molecular Luminescence Spectrometry: Chapter 15
•Infrared Spectrometry: Chapters 16&17
•Raman Spectrometry: Chapter 18
•Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy: Chapter 19
•Surface Characterization by Spectroscopy and Microscopy: Chapter 21
reviews.comment_teaching:
A 9am course with boring and flat tone from Prof Wu. Very easy to fall asleep, make sure you keep yourself busy to stay awake.

I adopted the suggestions by other contributor's @USTSPACE saying that it will be better to write your own notes, which I think was REALLY helpful. Given that the PPT Prof. Wu provided was lack of word/descriptions/titles etc. My practices was to type down his descriptions/remarks/notes next to the PPT slides for my revision. DON'T just rely on his PPT notes, its messy and full with pictures that have no explanations.

I also tried reading the textbook, but the e-version textbook I got has low resolutions. And Prof.Wu's PPT uses diagrams that cannot be found on the textbook, I found this method not effective for me and started to listen to his lessons carefully and make my own notes.

He sometimes uses the whiteboard to explain things, which can be hardly seen via zoom recordings. And the curser DISAPPEARED in the zoom recordings, so all I can hear was "use this to do this" with a bunch of ??? in my head. Was grateful that I attendant most of the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
100% final.
100MCQ in 90 minutes, open book.
Mean: 54.11/100

A copy of past paper from previous midterm+final was given. Only the midterm had solutions from the tutorial. There were no solution for the final past paper.
reviews.comment_workload:
He CANCELLED midterm due to COVID, thus 100% final. Which is a DISATER as you have tones of materials to test you in one go.

The TAs are lazy are some of the questions from are directly copied from past papers...so be sure do the past papers :)))

reviews.author: hfchanae
reviews.comment_content: The course first covers principles of electrochemical analysis, chromatography and mass spectroscopy before mid term exam. After that , it talks about light transmittance , NMR,etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecture was quite boring and the professor would mostly refer to what had been mentioned on the lecture notes. Therefore, revising the lecture notes and finish the sample exam paper is my tactic to the course,rather than just sitting the lecture
reviews.comment_grading:
Mean is low in the mid term : 43.9
/100
Final a bit better: 58.5
reviews.comment_workload: Very heavy. Every part shown on the lecture note would be tested in the exams. Remember most of he diagrams of the experiments because u need to draw them and explain the principles during exams.

reviews.author: hkusttoxicjj
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm:
Introduction to Instrumental Method
Electroanalytical Chemistry
Potentiometry
Coulometry
Voltammetry
Atomic and Molecular Mass Spectrometry

Final:
Introduction to Optical Spectrometric Methods
Introduction to Optical Atomic Spectrometry
Atomic Absorption and Emission Spectrometry
Atomic X-Ray Spectrometry
Ultraviolet/Visible Molecular Absorption Spectrometry
Molecular Luminescence Spectrometry
Infrared Spectrometry
Raman Spectrometry
Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy
Surface Characterization by Spectroscopy and Microscopy

The first part of the content overlaps a bit with an chem I. But this course mainly talks about the working principle of the components of different equipment so it needs certain extent of memorisation.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is quite well and the concepts are explained clearly. The pace of teaching is appropriate. Yet, the lecture notes are very messy. You possibly cannot understand them until you listen to his explanation. Please don't skip the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
40% midterm
60% final

The exams require understanding of the concepts and also drawing diagrams. Btw, remember to do past paper. Some parts of the paper are informative and helpful for your exam preparation ;)
reviews.comment_workload: No graded assignments. You only need to memorise the contents of lecture notes for midterm and final.

reviews.author: helloworld
reviews.comment_content:
midterm前:
intro+basic statistics
electrochemistry
potentiometry
coulometry
voltammetry
mass spec

midterm後:
optical methods
aas, aes
xray, xrf, xps
uv, vis+ luminescence
IR+ raman
NMR

好多野an chem 1都有提過下，但神童會教得深d同多數d，要識畫圖同寫返d equation出黎，midterm前多數計d，對chem人黎講可能難d，midterm後d野正正常常其他course都有學過下(如果有讀過4字頭electives)，冇學過都吹到兩咀，考試題目基本上notes都實有出現過
reviews.comment_teaching:
神童英文以chem dept標準黎講算係咁，但真係細聲到呢...如果唔係早5分鐘入去坐到前排既話都係走堂自修把啦

同陳雲d slides係200頁入面有10頁有用比較，神童d slides係40頁40頁都會考，總之notes出現過既野背曬就ok，midterm後部分notes都幾1999，唔上堂既話建議睇書
reviews.comment_grading:
stat下面有人講左，唔重複

check卷世界級on9，答案得一份copy，仲要搵鉛筆寫d冇step既答案喺一堆溶溶地既冇釘埋既爛紙上，搵齊7頁答案就可以召喚神童，ta又唔熟書，問親點解扣分就話因為寫唔足point，多謝曬

好似從良唔做killer，midterm final both above 1 sd就有A range，overall 86%已經夠A+
reviews.comment_workload:
正正常常啦，冇d人吹到咁大，midterm前比心機d背equation就ok
midterm同final都係大概250頁slide要背咁上下

reviews.author: cheeeeeeeeee
reviews.comment_content:
There are lots of overlap with 2310, but I think this course learn everything more in-depth.
Although the contents were lots heavier than 2310, you can learn more.
Basically, you do not need to do textbook questions / calculation problems.
Understanding the basic mechanisms and the background principles helps alot.

<Chapters>
Before midterm
-classification analytical methods
-electroanalytical chemistry
- potentiometry
- coulometry
- voltammetry
-mass spec

After midterm:
- optical instruments
- atomic optical spectroscopy
- x-ray spectroscopies
-UV-Vis Spect
- molecular luminescece
-IR
-Raman
- NMR
reviews.comment_teaching:
He actually bombard lots of information during the class.
But what he says are actually really useful and if you take notes of what he says, it would really help you.
He doesn't like when you ask stupid questions , for example when you ask without revising properly. So make sure to ask after you revise well X)
reviews.comment_grading:
50% midterm
50% final
Mean for midterm: 51.7
sd: 16.3
Mean for final :  59.9
sd: 17.6

Final was easier than the midterm test.
Actually he recycles alot from the past paper (he even provides the past paper in the beginning of the semester) so you really need to revise the past paper for good grades
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload for this course depends on you.
There are lots of things for memorization but you do not have any homework/ assignments.
So if you don't really revise for the course, there isn't much things to work on during the semester.
But if you do try to memorize everything, it would be better if you prepare/ revise the contents thoroughly throughout the semester, and the workload would be heavier.

reviews.author: Quaesitor
reviews.title: Bulky ppt with tonnes of pauses
reviews.comment_content:
Midterms
•Introduction to Instrumental Method: Chapter 1&Appendix 1
•Electroanalytical Chemistry-An Introduction: Chapter 22
•Potentiometry: Chapter 23
•Coulometry: Chapter 24
•Voltammetry: Chapter 25
•Atomic and Molecular Mass Spectrometry: Chapters 11&20

Finals
•Introduction to Optical Spectrometric Methods: Chapters 6&7
•Introduction to Optical Atomic Spectrometry: Chapter 8
•Atomic Absorption and Emission Spectrometry: Chapters 9&10
•Atomic X-Ray Spectrometry: Chapter 12
•Ultraviolet/Visible Molecular Absorption Spectrometry: Chapters 13&14
•Molecular Luminescence Spectrometry: Chapter 15
•Infrared Spectrometry: Chapters 16&17
•Raman Spectrometry: Chapter 18
•Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy: Chapter 19
•Surface Characterization by Spectroscopy and Microscopy: Chapter 21
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Wu does explain things clearly, but the pauses that he made is very distracting and I find it hard to concentrate during his class since I cannot catch up with his flow, so I simply give up and crammed all lecture video during the final period. The process of cramming is painful since I have to get back again and again in order to understand what he is trying to explain. Furthermore, forget about the powerpoints. Those powerpoints are filled with tonnes of pictures and failed to provide useful information. You will find making your own lecture notes by listening to his lecture will be even more useful.
reviews.comment_grading:
I will say it's fair in terms of grading, however, the exam is not enough to reflect whether you have grasp the content of the course. The exams are open-booked filled with easy MCs which you can score high only by knowing where the concepts are and some elementary school calculation, but the time limit will make you unable to check the questions one by one during the exam, so as long as you spend a day or two to get an idea where the concepts are and look up for them at high speed during exam you're guaranteed an A-.

Mean and SDs for midterms and finals are provided by supermin, so I will not repeat this again. However, the 8.74 SD in the final is 100 full marks based.

Midterm 31/50
Final 39/50 is enough to get A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy as I have to add many details to his provided PowerPoint. Exercises are useful for understanding but it will be overkill if you managed to do all of them, since exams only requires you to answer easy concept questions.

reviews.author: yiyo
reviews.comment_content: 做哂PAST PAPER同記番佢NOTES既野就有可能踩MEAN (score of mid term paper and final paper)

上堂冇咩BREAK, 其實上佢堂都幾悶, 但上佢堂會起碼都明D COURSE MATERIAL, 所以最好都唔好SKIP堂, 因為佢大部分都考番lecture notes 野
